# removeConstraints(_:)

**Instance Method**

Removes the specified constraints from the view.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor func removeConstraints(_ constraints: [NSLayoutConstraint])
```

## Parameters

- **constraints**: The constraints to remove.

## Discussion

When developing for iOS 8.0 or later, use the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/NSLayoutConstraint] class’s  [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/NSLayoutConstraint/deactivate(_:)] method instead of calling the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIView/removeConstraints(_:)] method directly. The [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/NSLayoutConstraint/deactivate(_:)] method automatically removes the constraints from the correct views.

## Managing the view’s constraints

- **constraints**: The constraints held by the view.
- **addConstraint(_:)**: Adds a constraint on the layout of the receiving view or its subviews.
- **addConstraints(_:)**: Adds multiple constraints on the layout of the receiving view or its subviews.
- **removeConstraint(_:)**: Removes the specified constraint from the view.
